metadata.Title: CVE-2022-26491 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description: An issue was discovered in Pidgin before 2.14.9. A remote attacker who canspoof DNS responses can redirect a client connection to a malicious server.The client will perform TLS certificate verification of the maliciousdomain name instead of the original XMPP service domain, allowing theattacker to take over control over the XMPP connection and to obtain usercredentials and all communication content. This is similar toCVE-2022-24968.

criterions.comment: pidgin package in esm-apps/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
